result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole E. Bellow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: as agreed to, court orders total $1317.92 including 5% & 10% surcharges  (SEE ATTACHED) $1141.06 (to victim David Swearingen $889.50 PAID  see attached) balance due $428.42 due during probation.

court orders Absolute sobriety (No possession or consumption of any alcohol, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia without valid prescriptions. Not to go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores, festival tents, etc.
court allows defendant to drive but to work only.
court orders Home detention till 6/8/15 except for school, work or with an adult.

$243.00 on this case and court orders DNA surcharge $200.00 on this case all due during probation.  ON  FINE, RESTITUTION, SURCHARGE AND COSTS, court orders defendant pay at least $75.00 per week total beginning 6/1/15 till paid in full.  In addition, on this case, court orders any & all necessary DOC supervision fees due during probation.

timeConds.notes:
with Huber (No good time) court grants 1 day jail credit on this case, to commence No later than 6/8/15, 12 noon
